required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tear Film SARS-nCoV-2 Detection in Symptomatic and Pauci-symptomatic Patients.
clinical_study.official_title: Tear Film SARS-nCoV-2 Detection in Symptomatic and Pauci-symptomatic

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the presence of SARS-nCoV-2 in the tear film of symptomatic and pauci-symptomatic SARS-nCoV-2 positive patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
The end goal of the study is to show whether or not the virus can be found in the tear film in both symptomatic and less symptomatic patients by means of serial sampling.
A sample of the tears / conjunctiva will be taken with a soft brush (similar to a cotton swab) every three days until the end of the hospitalization. In addition, you must complete a questionnaire that assesses the symptoms present.

primary_outcome.measure: The presence of SARS-nCoV-2 in the tear film of symptomatic and pauci-symptomatic SARS-nCoV-2 positive patients.
primary_outcome.description: Conjunctival sampling will be performed on both eyes after the application of a drop of topical anesthesia

primary_outcome.measure: Correlations between SARS-nCoV-2 in the tear film
primary_outcome.description: Correlations between SARS-nCoV-2 in the tear film and mild (like anosmia, ageusia, upper and lower respiratory tract infection) or severe symptoms (as pneumonia, need for hospitalization) of COVID-19.

arm_group.description: The first part of our study is to confirm the detectability of the SARS-nCoV-2 in the tear film of symptomatic patients.

intervention.description: Each eye will be sampled with a single, sterile, nylon, flocked swab

study_pop.textblock: positive test for SARS-nCoV-2 on a nasopharyngeal swab.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject needs to be above 18 years old.
- The subject is willing to undergo sampling of the conjunctiva.
- The subject is willing to fill in a questionnaire.
- The subject is fluent in written and verbal Dutch.
- The subject is capable of giving informed consent.
- Applicable for part 1 only: the subject test positive for SARS-nCoV-2 on a nasopharyngeal swab. The time window between a positive nasopharyngeal swab and the first conjunctival swab may be no more than 3 days.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergy to Oxybuprocainehydrochloride
- Pregnancy or lactation
